intro: Herpestis egensis, commonly known as the Egypts spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub with narrow, fleshy leaves and small yellowish flowers. Its sap contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans. Herpestis egensis is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water availability.
